name: market for coke | coke | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29448/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'coke', in the China geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;coke' is a fossil fuel with a calorific value of 28.6 MJ/kg. It is used as a solid fuel and is sourced from hard coal coke furnaces. Its main applications are in the following sectors: industrial fuel.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'coke',  within the geography of China.

This activity ends with the supply of 'coke',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/19:Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products/191:Manufacture of coke oven products/1910:Manufacture of coke oven products

flow.name: coke
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/19:Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products/191:Manufacture of coke oven products/1910:Manufacture of coke oven products

exchanges.description: Literature Value. According to reference, 23% of coke is produced by dry quenching, it is assumed the remaining is produced by wet quenching. Reference: Liu, X., & Yuan, Z. (2016). Life cycle environmental performance of by-product coke production in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 112, 1292–1301. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2014.12.102

Estimated Value. Based on transport values for coal in China. Reference(s): Wang, C., Ducruet, C., 2014.Transport corridors and regional balance in China: the case of coal trade and logistics. / Journal of Transport Geography 40 (2014) 3-16. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jtrangeo.2014.08.009
Adjusted to the unit of 1MJ.
